com.yantra.api.omp.order

Interface reserveAvailableInventory

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.OMPApi, YIFApi

    public interface reserveAvailableInventory

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      org.w3c.dom.Document reserveAvailableInventory(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The reserveAvailableInventory API can be used to find and reserve inventory simultaneously.

    • Method Detail

      • reserveAvailableInventory

        org.w3c.dom.Document reserveAvailableInventory(YFSEnvironment env,
                                               org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                        throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                               java.rmi.RemoteException

        The reserveAvailableInventory API can be used to find and reserve inventory simultaneously.

        This API makes a findInventory call to inquire about the product availability . Based on findInventory's output reserveItemInventory API is invoked with a ReservationID to reserve inventory for the product. If reservation is made successful, reservation details can be passed to the createOrder API. The order will then consume the inventory from the previously made reservations based on the ReservationID.

        This API does not block capacity for service lines. If service lines are passed, they are considered to find the best solution for product lines.

        Please refer javadoc for findInventory and reserveItemInventory for more information.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:

          Please refer to the user exits of the findInventory API.

        Events Raised:

          Please refer to the events of the reserveItemInventory API.

        Template Support:
        No.

        Database Extensibility Support: Partial. The ShipNode element is exposed.

        Additional Information:
        API throws error if availability is maintained externally for primary enterprise code of inventory organization or ShipNode.

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by createEnvironment.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        null
        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException
